sentence.Network_en: Poor George , only a year older than his scapegrace brother, looked sixty.
sentence.Network_cn: 可怜的乔治才比他那放荡不羁的弟弟大一岁, 却显得有六十岁了.

scapegoat 贝尔尼, scapegrace 红喉潜呜, scapegoating 正是

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from scape (see scapegoat) + grace, literally denoting a person who escapes the grace of God
